data.text: @PHealthGnome @Kjhooer Most studies were from the US. US regions w/ mask mandates cared about Covid and had other restrictions early on in the pandemic vs regions with no mask mandates

@PHealthGnome @jvipondmd First Hong Kong now NZ. The Covid zero fantasy is breaking down. What’s happening?
https://t.co/6WBlpoW4ru

@PHealthGnome Yes it does. We started seeing cases trending down late April. If cases can go down without masks how can you reliably use cases going down as proof they work? Cases started going up again in September, months after the mandate. Proof they didn't work?

@Kjhooer The purpose of that is to look at when there was a mix of regions that did our didn’t have masking. Reasons that did have mask mandates during that period had fewer cases, hospitalizations, and deaths. The overall trend line doesn’t matter.

@PHealthGnome Lol, march to December. Geezus. Mask mandates came in July. What reduced cases from march to July. What happened after December? Suddenly not so effective?

What a joke.
@PHealthGnome So ready for a return to normal. If the rest of the world can manage, I'm sure we'll be just fine.

@PHealthGnome Smoking on TTC subway trains used to be 'normal'....
Riding in the bed of pickup trucks used to be 'normal'....
Pregnant people drinking alcohol used to be 'normal'....
And going maskless used to be 'normal' too.

#ontpoli #maskup #COVIDisAirborne #COVID19 https://t.co/024KexKfBv
